title: Security: Use environment variables for GitHub token instead of storing in config
description:
Currently the GitHub token might be stored directly in the claude_desktop_config.json file. This is a security risk as:

1. Config files are often committed to repos or backed up
2. Tokens in plain text files can be accidentally exposed
3. Token rotation requires editing config files

**Goal:** 
Modify Bob to accept GitHub token from environment variable (e.g., GITHUB_TOKEN, GH_TOKEN) instead of requiring it in the config file.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Bob checks environment variables for GitHub token
- Config file only needs token variable name reference (or nothing at all)
- Clear documentation on which env vars are supported
- Fallback behavior if no token found (graceful error)
- Example configuration in README/docs

**Security Benefits:**
- Tokens never written to disk in config files
- Easier token rotation
- Follows 12-factor app principles
- Compatible with secret management systems
